channel.description: Latest threat intelligence threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Drones Emerge as Urgent Cyber Threat to Critical Infrastructure
item.description:
A report published on January 21, 2026, by the University of Canberra and Cisco warns of the urgent and escalating cyber threat posed by drones to critical infrastructure. The study highlights that as drone technology becomes more advanced, accessible, and affordable, its potential for use in cyber ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence, Industrial Control Systems

item.title: Threat Landscape Converges as Attackers Target ICS and AI Systems
item.description:
New research from Cyble highlights a dangerous convergence of threats, as both hacktivists and financially motivated cybercriminals are increasingly targeting Industrial Control Systems (ICS), Operational Technology (OT), and enterprise AI systems. The report, published January 20, 2026, notes that ...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Industrial Control Systems, Cyberattack

item.title: ScarCruft APT: North Korean Hackers Evolve Tactics in 'Artemis' Campaign
item.description:
The North Korean advanced persistent threat (APT) group ScarCruft, also known as APT37 or Reaper, has launched a new campaign dubbed 'Artemis'. Active since late 2025, the campaign targets entities likely in South Korea using malicious Hanword Word Processor (HWP) documents. Researchers report that ...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Infoblox to Acquire Axur, Expanding into AI-Powered External Threat Disruption
item.description:
Infoblox, a leader in DNS security and network services, has announced a definitive agreement to acquire Axur, a company specializing in AI-driven external threat detection and takedown. The acquisition will extend Infoblox's preemptive security offerings, enabling customers to combat threats like p...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Phishing, Other

item.title: SpyCloud Unveils Supply Chain Threat Protection to Combat Third-Party Identity Risks
item.description:
SpyCloud has launched its Supply Chain Threat Protection solution, a new platform designed to give organizations visibility into identity-related compromises within their vendor and supplier ecosystems. By leveraging a massive repository of recaptured data from breaches and malware infections, the s...

item.title: CISA Mandates Patch for Exploited Windows Zero-Day Used in Attack Chains
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has ordered federal agencies to patch a zero-day vulnerability in the Windows Desktop Window Manager (CVE-2026-20805) by February 3, 2026. The medium-severity information disclosure flaw is being actively exploited in the wild as a cru...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Threat Intelligence

item.title: Russian GRU Hackers (APT28) Evolve Credential-Harvesting Tactics
item.description:
The Russian GRU-linked threat group BlueDelta, also known as APT28 or Fancy Bear, has been observed refining its credential-harvesting operations. According to research from Recorded Future, campaigns between February and September 2025 targeted energy, defense, and policy organizations in Europe an...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Phishing, Threat Intelligence

item.title: G7 Urges Financial Sector to Prepare for Quantum Computing Threat
item.description:
The G7 Cyber Expert Group (CEG), co-chaired by the U.S. Department of the Treasury and the Bank of England, has issued a public statement and roadmap advising the global financial sector to begin a coordinated transition to quantum-resilient technology. The guidance warns that advanced quantum compu...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

item.title: Cyber-Fraud Now Top Global Threat, Surpassing Ransomware, WEF Report Finds
item.description:
The World Economic Forum's (WEF) 'Global Cybersecurity Outlook 2026' report, produced with Accenture, reveals a major shift in the threat landscape: cyber-enabled fraud and phishing have now surpassed ransomware as the top concern for global business leaders. The report highlights that fraud has rea...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Threat Intelligence, Regulatory

item.title: High-Severity Code Injection Flaw in Open WebUI (CVE-2025-64496) Allows RCE
item.description:
A high-severity vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-64496, has been discovered in Open WebUI, a popular self-hosted interface for large language models (LLMs). The flaw, found by Cato Networks, allows a malicious AI server to inject arbitrary JavaScript code into a user's browser session. This can be...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Cloud Security, Threat Intelligence
